warn.lucidity.photosensitive-seizure-war:
Photosensitive seizure warning
A very small percentage of people may experience a seizure when exposed to certain visual images, including flashing lights or patterns that may appear in video games. Even people who have no history of seizures or epilepsy may have an undiagnosed condition that can cause these “photosensitive epileptic seizures” while playing video games.
Immediately stop playing and consult a doctor if you experience any symptoms.
These seizures may have a variety of symptoms, including lightheadedness, altered vision, eye or face twitching, jerking or shaking of arms or legs, disorientation, confusion, or momentary loss of awareness. Seizures may also cause loss of consciousness or convulsions that can lead to injury from falling down or striking nearby objects.
Parents should watch for or ask their children about the above symptoms. Children and teenagers are more likely than adults to experience these seizures.
You may reduce risk of photosensitive epileptic seizures by taking the following precautions:
1.Play in a well-lit room.
2.Do not play if you are drowsy or fatigued.
If you or any of your relatives have a history of seizures or epilepsy, consult a doctor before playing video games.
config.lucidity.title: Lucidity
config.lucidity.description.selectiveRen: Render only blocks, entities, and particles that players wish to render.
config.lucidity.description.renderSelect: Mark the space of the block that will be selected.
config.lucidity.description.autoNightVis: When selective rendering is enabled, the player will automatically receive a night vision effect. This is to prevent block cross-sections from being too dark.
config.lucidity.description.spectator_se: Selection in spectator mode without wand.
config.lucidity.description.wand:
Specify the wand item by entering its name.
Example: minecraft:blaze_rod
In Survival mode, the wand can select regions without blocking entity or block interactions.
In Creative mode, the wand can select regions but blocks entity or block interactions.
Left-click with the wand to select an area; right-click to select a specific block type.
Ctrl + left-click adds to the selection, and Shift + left-click removes unfinished selections.
config.lucidity.description.wand_apply: Specify whether the wand's selection is applied to blocks, entities, or particles for selective rendering.
config.lucidity.should_add_area: Both points are recorded. press addSelection key to add a region.
config.lucidity.cant_add_area: Please complete the selection of Points 1 and 2 before adding a region.
config.lucidity.render_mode.render_both_: Render specific content both inside and outside
Exclude specific content both inside and outside
config.lucidity.wand.selectP1: Left-click: Select point1 of the area.
config.lucidity.wand.selectP2: Right-click: Select point2 of the area.
config.lucidity.description.keyPresses: Render Key-Presses at bottom right corner of the screen.
config.lucidity.description.damageIndica: Simply indicates the location of the damage source.
The amount by which the damage indicator is offset from the center of the screen.
config.lucidity.damageIndicator.time: Time the damage indicator stays on the screen.
config.lucidity.description.heighLightLa: Gives fluids source a different highlight texture.(resources/lucidity/textures/block/lava_flow & lava_still)
command.explosion-visualizer.block_damag: ExplosionVisualizer: Block detection ray render range updated.
ExplosionVisualizer: Block detection ray render layer updated.
command.explosion-visualizer.block_detec: ExplosionVisualizer: Block detection ray render settings reset!
ExplosionVisualizer: Block detection ray render layer reset!
ExplosionVisualizer: Block detection ray render range reset!
command.explosion-visualizer.fake_explos: ExplosionVisualizer: Fake explosion: %s was added at %s with power of %s
ExplosionVisualizer: Failed to add fake explosion %s at %s: duplicate naming!
config.option.description.main_render: This is the main render. Make sure to turn this on first!
config.option.description.block_destruct: Render the blocks to be destroyed by explosion.
config.option.description.block_detectio: Render the detection rays for detecting the blocks to be destroyed by explosion.
config.option.description.sample_points: Render in range entity's sample-points for ray-cast in explosion.
config.option.description.explosion_dama: Render explosion damage for in-range entities.
config.description.block_detection_ray_s:
In Minecraft, 1532 rays are emitted from the center of the explosion towards the outermost layer of a 16x16x16 voxel grid surrounding the explosion center. 
(See" https://minecraft.fandom.com/wiki/Explosion" for details.)

Displaying them all together can look very cluttered. This command allows you to slice these rays for easier viewing.
config.option.description.block_detectio: Text of the icon for the detection rays
config.option.block_detection_ray_icon_s: Block detection ray render icon size
config.option.description.block_detectio: Size of the icon for the detection rays
config.option.description.render_with_al: Render explosion power by ray's alpha.
config.option.description.block_destruct: Color of the icon for the blocks that will be destroyed by the explosion
Text of the icon for the blocks that will be destroyed by the explosion
Size of the icon for the blocks that will be destroyed by the explosion
config.option.description.entity_sample_: Size of the icon for the blocks that will be destroyed by the explosion
config.lucidity.description.mob_spawn: Types of mobs that can Spawn on block surfaces.
config.lucidity.description.mob_eye-line: When the monster's eyes can be connected to yours, it will see you!
config.lucidity.description.arrowcam: Press ctrl while shooting out a projectile will bind your camera on to that projectile, press shift to reset you camera.
config.lucidity.description.betterStruct: Structure void block will be rendered in a better look.
config.lucidity.description.betterBarrie: Barrier block will be rendered in a better look.
config.lucidity.description.betterLightB: Light block will be rendered in a better look.
config.lucidity.description.forceTechnic: Force technical blocks(barrier,structure void,light...) to render.
config.lucidity.description.clientsideDa: Calculate basic damage on client side(May not accurate!).
config.lucidity.description.blockEventRe: Render block events happened.(Directly intercepting server packets does not guarantee the accuracy of the observation. The actual order should be based on the server.)
